Dental care, optical services, and physiotherapy are readily available. Many retirees report healthcare quality meeting or exceeding their home countries' standards, with significantly lower costs. Whether managing chronic conditions or requiring emergency services, San Miguel de Salinas residents enjoy peace of mind regarding medical access and quality.

faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without residency requirements. Non-residents obtain a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), a straightforward administrative process. Many buyers work with English-speaking Spanish solicitors and property agents familiar with international transactions. Costs typically include 10% transfer tax, legal fees (0.6-1%), and notary fees. Financing through Spanish mortgage lenders is possible, with most banks offering competitive rates to foreign buyers with adequate documentation.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with over 320 days of annual sunshine. Winter temperatures average 15-18°C—mild without extreme cold. Summer temperatures reach 28-32°C—warm but moderated by sea breezes. Rainfall concentrates in autumn/spring with dry summers. This predictable, mild climate suits retirees avoiding harsh winters while remaining comfortable during summer. Winter gardening and outdoor activities remain feasible throughout the year. Air quality typically exceeds many European cities.
